author: Francisco-Gamino
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
``` powershell
# Build PowerShell

# Start PowerShell Core at this location:
E:\GitHub\PowerShell\test\powershell\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics>

# Run Import-Counter tests
.\Import-Counter.Tests.ps1

```
The file to update is the following:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/c97ca777dfb2536dc79051dfa1ae7dce852df125/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics/CounterTestHelperFunctions.ps1#L262

Expected behavior
-----------------
All test pass

Actual behavior
---------------

```powershell
# We had one failure in appveyor 

Test failure
Description: Can import samples ending at a given end time (BLG format)
Name:        Feature tests for Import-Counter cmdlet.Can import samples ending at a given end time (BLG format)
message:
Expected: {11}
But was:  {20}
stack-trace:
at line: 262 in C:\projects\powershell-f975h\test\powershell\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics\CounterTestHelperFunctions.ps1
$setA.Length | Should Be $setB.Length
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: Francisco-Gamino
comments.body: @TravisEz13 : Could you please send @MiaRomero the logging example you were talking about? Thanks.

title: Need to add logging to understand failures Import-Counter.Tests.ps1
